subject: Re: [junit] A Growing Problem
msgSnippet: ... Keep doing the best you can.  :-) In my experience, if you attempt to mask a problem it will never get resolved.  I d be inclined to let all the tests fail
messageBody:
Stevens, Timothy J. (LNG-MBC) wrote:

> I was thinking more along the lines of a weekly build type of
>process, where everyone puts their updated code into a central location and
>the buildmaster compiles and tests everything. I can easily envision a case
>where someone either forgets to test their code or checks in the wrong code.
>If a suite of tests was represented within a single test, you would get a
>single confusing error rather than a flurry of errors which might give you a
>better idea of what's going on.
>
> Yes, it would be nice if we were all in an agile/extreme world where
>everyone was testing their code multiple times a day and builds were a daily
>occurrence, but some of us are in traditional with the "fragile" way of
>doing things and are doing the best we can ;-)
>

Keep doing the best you can. :-)

In my experience, if you attempt to mask a problem it will never get
resolved. I'd be inclined to let all the tests fail once the first one
trips up. Then I get an opportunity to feel the pain. In response, I
have to make a decision about whether building more often would be more
or less painful. Without that feedback, I find it's difficult for me to
improve the process because I miss opportunities for minor course
corrections.

Mike
